IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO DISCOVER TREATMENTS AND A CURE FOR ALS, AND TO SERVE, ADVOCATE FOR, AND EMPOWER PEOPLE AFFECTED BY ALS TO LIVE THEIR LIVES TO THE FULLEST.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO DISCOVER TREATMENTS AND A CURE FOR ALS, AND TO SERVE, ADVOCATE FOR, AND EMPOWER PEOPLE AFFECTED BY ALS TO LIVE THEIR LIVES TO THE FULLEST.
IRS990.Desc: The ALS Association of Texas is dedicated to providing quality local care, investing in research, and advocating for people with ALS and their families. In 2022, the Organization assisted 1,510 people with ALS, including over 4,530 patient interactions, loaned over $2.97 million worth of equipment to patients, and conducted 182 virtual workshops, presentations and support groups for patients and families. The chapter partnered with and funded 13 ALS clinics in Texas, which oversaw 68 clinical trials. The ALS Association of Texas continues to grow, expanding access to crucial care and working to create a world without ALS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Organization is exempt from federal income taxes under section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code (IRC) and has not been classified as a private foundation as defined in the IRC. Income generated from activities unrelated to the Organizations exempt purposes is subject to tax under IRC Section 511. The Organization had no unrelated business income for the year ended January 31, 2023. Accordingly, no provision has been made for federal income tax. GAAP requires the evaluation of tax positions taken in the course of preparing the Organizations tax returns and recognition of a tax liability (or asset) if the Organization has taken an uncertain position that more likely than not would not be sustained upon examination by the Internal Revenue Service. Management has analyzed the tax positions taken by the Organization, and has concluded that as of January 31, 2023 there are no uncertain tax positions taken or expected to be taken that would require recognition of a liability (or asset) or disclosure in the financial statements.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MEDICAL EQUIPMENT: THE ORGANIZATION SIGNS FORMAL AGREEMENTS WITH PATIENTS WHICH REQUIRE: (1) ACKNOWLEDGMENT THAT THE PATIENT IS UNABLE TO OBTAIN PAYMENT FOR SUCH EQUIPMENT FROM THE INSURANCE CARRIER; AND (2) THE RETURN OF ANY EQUIPMENT WHEN NO LONGER NEEDED. THE UNIQUE EQUIPMENT PROVIDED IS SPECIFIC TO THE NEEDS OF ALS PATIENTS.CASH GRANTS: THESE GRANTS ARE AWARDED ON A COST-REIMBURSEMENT BASIS. THE ORGANIZATION FIRST APPROVES AN APPLICATION COMPLETED BY THE PATIENT. THEREAFTER, THE PATIENT SUBMITS REIMBURSEMENT PAPERWORK AND PROOF OF EXPENSES.CLINIC PAYMENTS: EACH CLINIC PROVIDES THE ORGANIZATION WITH AN ANNUAL REPORT INDICATING THE USAGE OF AWARDED FUNDS.

mental health support, new virtual groups and events for individuals living with ALS and for caregivers/family members. Newly Diagnosed Group, fAmiLy talkS: Essential Conversations (for couples; partners and spouses) a new Caregiver workshop, Comfort Kits for young caregivers/family members, Emergency Preparedness, Financial Estate Planning, Mental Health Awareness Love Moves Us Forward, Counseling Support, Kids Magic Show, Cultural Values in Caregiving Panel.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 1a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOLLOWING IS AN EXCERPT FROM THE ORGANIZATION'S BYLAWS: "THE CORPORATION SHALL HAVE AN EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. THE PRESIDENT, SECRETARY, TREASURER AND ALL VICE PRESIDENTS SHALL CONSTITUTE THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, WHICH, UNLESS DETERMINED OTHERWISE BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, SHALL BE EMPOWERED TO EXERCISE THE POWER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS BETWEEN MEETINGS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE APPOINTS COMMITTEE CHAIRS AND, AS PROVIDED IN THESE BYLAWS, FILLS VACANCIES OF DIRECTORS AND OFFICERS."

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FINANCE COMMITTEE REVIEWED AN ELECTRIC COPY OF THIS RETURN WITH THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND AUTHORIZED HIS SIGNATURE UPON APPROVAL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION FOR THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR WAS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY INDEPENDENT PERSONS IN AUGUST 2022, AND COMPARABILITY DATA IN THE FORM OF THE ANNUAL COMPENSATION REPORT FROM GUIDESTAR WAS CONSIDERED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THESE DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VIII INCOME FROM FUNDRAISING EVENTS
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The net economic benefit from our fundraising events is calculated as follows:Contributions from fundraising events reported on Part VIII, line 1c $ 1,643,906Gross income from fundraising events reported on Part VIII, line 8a 35,327Less: Direct costs of events reported on part VIII, Line 8b (110,112) Net economic benefit of fundraising $ 1,569,121
